english.segment1: When success is equated with excess. The ambition for excess wrecks us. When top of the mind becomes the bottom line. When success is equated with excess
english.segment2: If you're time ain't be nothing for money. I start to feel really bad for you honey. Maybe honey put you're money where your mouth's been running. If you're time ain't be nothing but money
english.segment3: I want out of this machine. It doesn't feel like freedom
english.segment4: (chorus). This ain't my American dream. I want to live and die for bigger things. I'm tired of fighting for just me. This ain't my American dream
english.segment5: When success is equated with excess. When we're fighting for the beamer, the lexus. As the heart and soul breathing the company goals. Where success is equated with excess
english.segment6: I want out of this machine. It doesn't feel like freedom
english.segment8: Cause baby's always talkin 'bout a ring. And talk has always been the cheapest thing. Is it true would you do what I want you to. If I show up with the right amount of bling?
english.segment9: Like a puppet on a monetary string. Maybe we've been caught singing. Red, white, blue, and green. But that ain't my America, That ain't my American dream
